title.value: Author Correction: BCG immunization induces CX3CR1 ^{hi} effector memory T cells to provide cross-protection via IFN-γ-mediated trained immunity
title.justification: The paper is a correction notice to a specific previously published article.
title.quote: Author Correction: BCG immunization induces CX3CR1 ^{hi} effector memory T cells to provide cross-protection via IFN-γ-mediated trained immunity

extractions.description: This document provides corrections to two previously published articles in Nature Immunology. The corrections address erroneous figure callouts and duplicated images in the original publications.

type.justification: The paper is a correction notice and does not provide any empirical data or experimental results itself.
type.quote: In the version of the article initially published, in the “BCG-induced CX3CR1 ^{hi} T cells are effector memory T cells” section, the first five callouts to Fig. 3 erroneously cited Fig. 2.

name.justification: Both corrections are published in Nature Immunology, indicating the primary field is Immunology.
The corrections involve vaccine-induced cellular responses related to BCG and SARS-CoV-2, fitting this sub-field.
name.quote: BCG immunization induces CX3CR1 ^{hi} effector memory T cells... Mucosal vaccine-induced cross-reactive CD8 ^{+} T cells protect against SARS-CoV-2...
